Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (866) 685-0006.

ALLEGATION:
On 1/26/22, youth was held in a prone restraint for over 4 minutes. Additionally, the
initiation of the restraint did not follow facility policy.
INVESTIGATION:
During a review of the 01/26/22 restraint of Youth A, additional details were asked of
the facility Director to clarify the initiation of the restraint and the youth being held in
2

a prone position. The Director reported that during the initiation of the restraint, Staff
2 entered the room and attempted to put Youth A into a restraint, but his momentum
took them to the floor. The Director also clarified that Youth A was held in a prone
position for several minutes due to her struggling and due to the staff reporting it
would not have been safe to roll her to a supine position. No injuries were reported.
I interviewed the Director and the Administrator at the facility on 02/10/22. A review
of the video of this incident occurred during this meeting. The video showed the
following: Youth A and Staff 1 were observed sitting in the day room when Youth A
threw a pitcher of water at Staff 1 without any signs of physical escalation. Youth A
got up and moved toward Staff 1, who was backing away from her. Staff 2 entered
the room and approached Youth A quickly from behind. Staff 2 wrapped his arms
around Youth A in a tackle type manner, and they fell forward onto a large foam
ottoman. Youth A was face down. Staff 1 helped secure Youth A and held her left
arm while Staff 2 held Youth A’s right arm. This was observed about 6:11:24 and
Youth A was half on and half off the ottoman. Her face and upper torso on the floor
and her waist and legs still on the ottoman. Staff 4 entered and tried to get ahold of
Youth A’s feet and Youth A slid off the ottoman. This was about 6:11:58. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 continued holding Youth A in a prone position on the floor while Staff 4 went
to retrieve mechanical restraints. About 6:13:15, Staff 3 entered and moved some
furniture to clear the area. Youth A was seen moving against staff at times during the
restraint. Once Staff 4 brought the mechanical restraints, Staff 3 put them on Youth
A. Once Youth A had leg and arm restraints on, the staff disengaged from the
restraint, but Youth A stayed in a prone position on the floor. This was observed at
about 6:17:30. Staff 2 appeared to say something to Staff 1, and Staff 1 left the area.
The remaining three staff talk to Youth A. About 6:18:58, the staff assisted Youth A
in rolling over and they helped her up to her feet and escorted her out of the area.
Youth A walked freely at this time.
Both the Director and Administrator agreed that the initiation of the restraint was not
in line with their restraint model, Handle With Care. Additionally, they both agreed
that the youth was held for an extended period in a prone position and understood
that was against Department policy and their own restraint policy, which notes no
prone restraints.
Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation is as follows:
 Incident Report for Youth A, dated 01/26/22, submitted by the Program
Manager. The report was consistent with the video and the reports by the
Director and Administrator.
 Incident Review Form, completed by the Program Manager, 01/27/22. Noted
‘PRT which led to a prone hold which is prohibited.’
 Facility policy 9.13 Use of Force: the policy requires restraints to be done in a
safe and appropriate manner, done in line with provided restraint training, and
prohibits prone restraints.
 Staff training documentation was verified for both Staff 1 and Staff 2 and
noted to be current.
3

 Disciplinary action was reviewed for Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 was reported
not to have any disciplinary action. Staff 2 had a disciplinary action form in his
file that was dated 2016 for not following restraint protocol.
 Performance Feedback form for Staff 1 related to this incident, dated
02/22/22, noted Staff 1 did not follow protocol by holding youth prone and not
making attempts to reposition her.
 Performance Feedback form for Staff 2 related to this incident, dated
02/22/22, noted Staff 2 did not follow protocol by not following Handle With
Care at the initiation of the restraint, as Staff 2 used more of a tackle, rather
than the Primary Restraint Technique in Handle With Care. It was additionally
noted that Staff 2 did not follow protocol by holding youth prone and not
making attempts to reposition her.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and procedures regarding restraint. These policies and
procedures shall be available to all residents, their
families, and referring agencies.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of
the minor child’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition,
medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and done in a
manner consistent with the resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: The facility is in violation of the rule as evidenced by the video of
this restraint showing Youth A was tackled from behind and
restrained prone for several minutes. The video and these
findings were reviewed with the Director and Administrator who
both agreed with the stated violation. The actions taken by staff,
to hold Youth A in this manner, were not safe or appropriate and
violated the facility policy.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
